commitResults.messageTitle: Duke class: add greeting messages
commitResults.messageBody:
There is no message to greet the users.

Greeting messages let the users know Duke has started.

Let's add hello and goodbye messages.

This version fulfils Level-0 requirements.

commitResults.messageTitle: Duke class: add function to read and echo users' commands
commitResults.messageBody:
There is no function to read and echo users' commands.

It is necessary to read and echo users' commands to capture their intention.

Let's add a function that read and echo users' command. If the command is "bye", display the goodbye message and exit the program.

This version fulfils Level-1 requirements.

commitResults.messageTitle: Duke class: add function to store and list users' commands
commitResults.messageBody:
There is no function to store and list users' commands.

It is necessary to allow users to store and list their previously entered commands.

Let's,
* add a function that stores users' command
* add a function that lists users' previously entered commands

This version fulfils Level-2 requirements.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Task class
commitResults.messageBody:
Tasks are represented using String..

It is more natural to use a Task class to represent tasks.

Let's create a Task class to represent tasks instead of using String.

commitResults.messageTitle: Duke class: add function to mark tasks as done
commitResults.messageBody:
There is no function to mark tasks as done.

It allows users to mark tasks as done so that the users can keep track of what are the outstanding tasks.

Let's add a function that marks tasks as done when the users enter "done x", in which x is the index of the task.

This version fulfils Level-3 requirements.

commitResults.messageTitle: Duke class: Add support for ToDos, Events, Deadlines
Add Automated Text UI Testing for "bye" case
Duke class: minor tweaks to conform to Java Coding Standard
Add DukeException to represent exceptions specific to Duke
Add error message when the description for deadline/event task is missing
Duke class: Improve code quality
Make Task class an abstract class
Put all classes in duke package
Change Event class and Deadline class to be subclass of Task class
Add support for deleting tasks from the list
Add feature to save and load tasks
Add JavaDoc comments for non-private classes/methods
Remove unicode characters to fix compatibility issues
Extract out Parser class, Storage class, TaskList class and Ui class from Duke class.
Change the "by" variable of Deadline class to java.time.LocalDateTime
Add function to find task by keyword
Add JUnit Tests
Make find function case-insensitive
Change delete task and mark task as done functions to use the indexes displayed by find command
Add JavaDoc to Ui class
Add JUnit tests for Deadline class
Divide classes into multiple packages
Extract Command class from Duke Class
Force users to use list/find command before using done/delete command to prevent wrong deletion
Add support for multiple keywords to find function
Fix minor bugs with user interface
Make the commands case-insensitive
Change Event class to support start datetime and duration of task
Improve JavaDocs for all classes
Fix a bug that causes the goodbye message to be displayed twice
Update docs\README.md
Update docs\README.md
Fix checkstyle errors
